oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Legislative Petition No. 61, 1841
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The women of Campbell County sent a petition to the legislature in which they requested the passage of anti-liquor laws in order to fight pauperism, crime, untimely deaths, and other "social evils." They assert that they are not trying to dictate law, but that they are exercising their right to solicit the enaction of laws.
Although women could not vote before the passage of the Nineteenth Amendment, they still participated in local politics through petitions and advocated for reform.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Women of Campbell County
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: RG 60: General Assembly Original Bills, Petitions, Reports, Etc., 1790-present
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Women--Civil Rights
Politicians; Political participation; Women; Suffrage; Susan B. Anthony
